revised_title: Contributions to the History of Pleiocene and Pleistocene Deer
tldr: The author studied the remains of deer found in various collections in Britain and on the Continent for over twenty-five years. In this communication, they describe two species: Cervus verticornis, known for its unique curved antlers, and Cervus Savini, a new species to science. Both species are found in the Pleiocene and early Pleistocene geological periods in Norfolk and Suffolk.
